meanings.sent1: There were a squillion stars in the sky.
meanings.sent2: She had to count a squillion jellybeans in the jar.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to guess how many jellybeans were in the jar, and one student shouted, 'A squillion!'
meanings.sent4: The possibilities were as vast as a squillion grains of sand on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's imagination held a squillion stories waiting to be told.

meanings.definition: A very large amount of money.
meanings.sent1: He made a squillion dollars from his successful business.
meanings.sent2: The company spent a squillion on their latest advertising campaign.
meanings.sent3: When the piggy bank broke, coins went flying everywhere, and the child exclaimed, 'A squillion dollars!'
meanings.sent4: The treasure chest was overflowing with a squillion gold coins.
meanings.sent5: The billionaire's mansion cost a squillion dollars to build.
